boardgame.name: Spook Mansion
boardgame.description:
Spook Mansion is an asymmetrical two player game.
One player is the investigator trying to escape and the other is the house itself attempting to ensure that this does not happen.

The investigator player uses action points to move through the haunted mansion trying to escape as the the house player places cards to expand the house or blocks of exits to draw more cards.

The investigator wins if he escapes before he runs out action points. Three times he can regain all his action points but there is a price, for a ghost will appear.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Philosophia: Floating World
boardgame.description:
Set in feudal Japan, Philosophia: Floating World is a deck-building game which can be played either in turn-taking or fully simultaneous mode. You can build majestic pagodas and Shinto shrines, learn ancient eastern wisdom, explore the world, or fight ancient monsters — or all of the above. This is a sandbox-style game, and how you play is up to you!

In Floating World, you play as one of six unique characters from Edo Japan, each with a unique power and a mysterious secret. The game plays simultaneously over three phases that repeat until one player has gained a victory condition. All phases occur simultaneously, and they are:


The Draw Phase: Draw six cards from your deck, then pass them to another player. They take these cards, discard one of their choice, then separate the remaining five cards into two piles, one containing two cards and one containing three. You do the same for another player, then take your two piles, discarding one of them and playing the other.
The Collect Phase: Collect items and bonuses indicated on the cards in your hand. You may also pay time tokens to perform extra actions in the next phase.
The Action Phase: Simultaneously take actions based on your cards in hand and those that you chose in the collect phase. Disputes caused by the simultaneous nature of these actions are resolved using the influence track, where the player at the top of the track chooses the outcome; choosing in your own interest, however, drops you to the bottom of the track.


Rounds continue in this way until a player gains any of the seven victory conditions available, such as collecting all four ganbaru tokens or discovering another player's secret location and achieving any two of the ganbaru tokens.

Philosophia: Floating World contains over 200 tarot-sized cards and 12 intricate miniatures and is filled with beautiful Ukiyo-e style Japanese art, all digitally remastered to regain the original vibrance of the era. Welcome to the Floating World!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Mens Erger Je Niet! Dierenvriendjes
boardgame.description:
Dutch

Het klassieke Mens Erger Je Niet! spel voor de allerkleinsten! Op de dobbelsteen staan symbolen die corresponderen met de velden op het bord. De kinderen hoeven dus nog niet te kunnen tellen om al mee te kunnen spelen!

Er zijn twee varianten; één voor de echte kleintjes waarbij alleen de pionnen thuisgebracht moeten worden, en één waarin ook tegenstanders van het bord gegooid mogen worden.

Geschikt van 2 tot 4 spelers van 4 tot 8 jaar.

English

The classic Ludo game for the little ones! On the dice are symbols corresponding to the spaces on the board. So the children do not have to be able to count to play!

There are two variants; one for the real little ones where only the pawns have to be brought home, and one in which opponents can also be thrown off the board.

Suitable for 2 to 4 players from 4 to 8 years old.

boardgame.name: In Search of the Old Faith
boardgame.description:
from the Introduction:
In the second edition of WFRP, the Old Faith no longer exists in the Empire, having given way to the worship of Taal and Rhya as well as the other gods. There are hints that the Druids and their followers left the Old World for other lands, particularly Albion.

But, what if they haven’t left? What if, instead, the children of the Old Faith lived on in the backcountry and isolated villages of the Empire, quietly practicing their ancient faith and remaining as unobtrusive as possible? Living in constant fear of another Great Persecution, how do followers of the Old Faith fit in the Empire?

boardgame.name: The Elves of the LaurÃ«lorn
boardgame.description:
from the Background:
With the returning of the WFRP license to Games Workshop, the chance of the much-anticipated WFRP Elf sourcebook making its way to print was reduced to nil. It seemed that the creativity of Martin Oliver was destined to remain alone in his computer.

This same fate was shared by some of the work created by Tim Eccles for the Laurëlorn Elves during the long gone, anarchical years of his youth. Some of the information made its way to the venerable WFRP Archives as an army list prior to the release of the WFB5 Wood Elf army book.

This project is an attempt to bring elements of the two views together with additional material to provide GMs and players of Elven characters with the background necessary to bring this little understood and detailed portion of the Empire to life.

It also should be noted here that Martin Oliver’s efforts concentrated on the Wood Elves of the Loren Forest. Portions of his work have been amended for the Wood Elf population in the northwestern corner of the Empire.

boardgame.name: Horror on the Buffalo River
boardgame.description:
Setting: The Ozarks, Arkansas, July 1923

The state of Arkansas is considering the fitness of a large wilderness area in and around the Buffalo River for state parkhood. Among the many institutions, organizations, and interest groups that the state government is consulting, the University of Arkansas is one of them. Since they have been asked to submit a report to the state legislature, the university would like to send a contingent of investigators (professors, students, and friends) to the area to collect information for inclusion in the report. It will be a pleasant break from the stresses of work on campus, and investigators are excited to get out into the peaceful woodlands of the Ozarks. It is considered a cushy assignment, and there is no reason at all to suspect an isolated backwoods horror experience replete with nasty things in the woods and terrifying run-ins with the culturally isolated locals.

-From Publisher Blurb

This core of this document contains six common types of Daemonette, each of which is the common Daemonette from the Tomb of Corruption Book advances through various careers, including the ‘ Alluress ’, ‘ Fell Maiden of Slaanesh ’, ‘ Lady of the Void ’ and ‘ Ruination of Imperfect Beauty ’ careers that are unique to Daemonettes and therefore have not been properly detailed.

Comic Book Crisis comes with an EXCLUSIVE comic book but the most exciting feature is that thanks to a patent-pending method, COMIC BOOK CRISIS can be played on ANY comic book ever published! boardgame.name: Capturez Tito! Operation RÃ¶sselsprung 1944
Operation RÃ¶sselsprung 1944
boardgame.description:
"Operation Rösselsprung" is an anti-partisan operation launched by German forces against the Yugoslav resistance between May 25 and June 3, 1944. This combined operation between the air and ground forces aims to seize - dead or alive - the chief of the resistance Josip Broz known as "Tito", whose hiding place was located in the village of Drvar in Bosnia and Herzegovina. The operational plan, which mobilizes 20,000 soldiers, is the responsibility of the XV Mountain Corps as well as the air forces. The first phase of the raid is led by airborne troops (paratroopers and gliders), the SS-fallschirmjäger battalion 500, a sort of disciplinary battalion. The second phase notably involved the 7th SS Prinz Eugen division, the Brandenburg regiment and its Chetnik subordinates, several reconnaissance Kampfgruppe as well as Croatian forces.

"Operation Rösselsprung 1944" is a solitaire tactical wargame appearing in the French Vae Victis magazine #151 (special game edition). The game is edited under ziplock and contains an A3-size map depicting Drvar (in Bosnia-Herzegovinia) and surroundings, 108 counters (25 counters representing the SS-fallschirmjäger bataillion 500 –- and 54 counters for the communist partisans). The rules are included in a separate 16 pages A5-sized booklet.

The systems uses the improved rules of the "Bruneval 1942" (VaeVictis #104) and "Commando 4 in action: Dieppe 1942" (VaeVictis #131) to simulate the airborne phase of the operation.

This game system developed for the "Raids" series is only playable in solo ; very easy to learn and fun to play ! The "Artificial intelligence" automatically manages Yugoslav actions while the player is in charge of German actions.

The map is point-to-point, one to several hundred meters apart. A game turn is equivalent to 2 hours during the day and 5 hours at night, the scenario begins at 6:00 am on May 25, 1944 and ends at 12:00 am on May 26, that is 12 game turns. One counter represents a full strenght, 35 to 40 German paratroopers, a company of 20 to 100 Yugoslav partisans, an officer, two anti-aircraft machine guns, or two Italian tanks L3-35.

Would you be smart enough to capture Tito, maximize the prizes and minimize your losses ? It’s up to you Captain !

boardgame.name: Age of Valor: Risorgimento 1859 - 1861
boardgame.description:
Risorgimento 1859 - 1861, the 2d Italian War of Independence is an independent Age of Valor (AOV) expansion chapter or mini-module for Age of Eagles II, also known as Napoleonic Fire & Fury. As such AOE II is needed to properly play this game. In most cases all rules changes have been imbedded in the Data Charts as well as the charts and tables on the Quick Reference Sheet. All players need to do is use these new specifications or DRMs with the original rules, then play as normal. Any changes unique to the Risorgimento 1859 - 1861, the subject of this expansion set, are included for both the conflict overall, and the included battles of Magenta, Solferino, San Martino and Volturno scenarios.

The AOV product line is sold primarily via a digital PDF distribution format, though a hardcopy version is available from certain retailers. It is 38 pages long

boardgame.name: Sloshed: Booze and Secrets
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

This was a short game I created to illustrate different resolution mechanics, and try to explore the possible categorizations of such.

From the introduction:

You are taking the roles of a bunch of buddies who haven't seen each other in a while, for whatever reason. It could be that you are recalling your separate tours of duty, maybe you went to different colleges, whatever. The point is you are now catching up. Somewhere along the way, you’ve done something you want to keep secret, but which your buddies will likely uncover during the course of the evening.

boardgame.name: Prowlers & Paragons Ultimate Edition: Waiting Room Edition
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The World Needs Heroes - Right Now!

March 31, 2020: In this time of global pandemic, when we are all urged to stay at home and maintain social distancing, online games are a powerful means to maintain community and interpersonal connection. We at Evil Beagle Games are working hand-in-hand with the amazing folks at Astral to provide an official Prowers & Paragons Ultimate Edition experience for everyone wanting to connect with friends anywhere in the world and just play.

That's why we've made this "Waiting Room Edition" of our complete game available to everyone. In light of how difficult things are financially, we've set the price at "Pay What You Want," with the full expectation you will grab it for free so you can have the complete experience and just come play with us. If, however, you find it's a worthy addition to your gaming library, we're grateful for anything you're willing to share back with us (it's a difficult financial time for us, too).

Welcome to the "Waiting Room Edition" for Prowlers & Paragons Ultimate Edition, the next-generation superhero RPG you've been waiting for!

Roll a handful of six-siders, count the evens (6s count double!), and describe a comic panel or cinematic moment that puts your friends in the scene.

Evolved from 2013's beloved Prowlers & Paragons game (found on several Top Ten lists of supers games), Prowlers & Paragons Ultimate Edition is Len Pimentel's (Hughesville High, TNT, Six-Gun Fury) masterwork, with extensive design support from Sean Patrick Fannon (Freedom Squadron, Savage Rifts, High Tech Enemies, The Mutant File). The two of them love superhero gaming, and you will love what they've done with this system.

P&PUE features:

Easy, intuitive game mechanics with just enough crunch to be truly fun to play!
Player-empowering narrative and shared descriptive experiences reflecting the best of 21st Century game design!
Fast and fun, character creation allows any concept you can imagine, any power set you might wish to play with.


This is the official Waiting Room Edition we distributed to all of the Backers of the Kickstarter to ensure they had a complete game to play. It has absolutely everything you need to set up and run a campaign, create any character you can imagine, and explore every facet of superpowered roleplaying.

boardgame.name: Throne of the Glass Eye: Elewynir
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Underneath a secret military outpost within a cave that is spewing out corrupted ghosts is a warlord that seeks unknown goals. Farther below is a sloshing pool of water whose upper layers are covered in scum. Scum that is separated by a ooze dripping skeleton at the edge of the shadows.

This adventure includes a dungeon, three quests to get the party into a dungeon, prompts baked into settings descriptions to encourage continued play and use of the adventure location. This 12 page adventure will fill a night with a weird and fun dungeon to fight against, with only a little work needed to convert creatures to your favorite old school fantasy tabletop role-playing game.

System Neutral
This adventure scenario was written to be system neutral, descriptions of damage are written using comparisons to weapons commonly found in old school fantasy tabletop systems. This is done to allow the game to bridge across as many rule sets as possible.

This adventure was not written with any levels in mind. It should be scary and played to be barren and haunted by failed activities that have recently become renewed.

boardgame.name: Spitzbub
boardgame.description:
Spitzbub is a bidding and bluffing game with 66 cards: 9 times the number cards 1 to 6 and 12 jokers, which can copy any number card.

Each player has 6 cards on their hand. It is played in turn.

The player picks one or more cards from their hand and the value of the cards, e. g. two times wolf (value 3). The player must claim that all of their cards have the same value, but may lie. Jokers can adopt any value. Then the player draws up to 6 cards in hand. The player to the left may accept or reject the claim. If they accept the claim, they take the cards in their hand.

Each bid must be higher than the previous one, either with the same number of cards with a higher value or with a higher number of cards with any value.

designer's blurb:
've been working on this project to consolidate all of the critical game information from all SR5 books including qualities, skill rules, weapon and armor tables, character creation rules, along with as much quick-reference critical information I can possibly gather and stuff it all into one big PDF. boardgame.name: Schmitz 21
boardgame.description:
A Blackjack inspired card game with 55 cards:
10 times the numbers 1, 2, 3, 5 and 6 [yes, there is no 4!] and 5 times the number 10.

Each player starts with four cards. A talon is formed from the rest of the cards. It is played in turn. The player plays one card, calls the total value of all played cards and draws one card. If the sum of the played cards is exactly 21, that player wins all played cards to a face-down pile. A player cannot play a card if the total value would exceed 21. If a player cannot play a card, the previous player wins the played cards.

The game ends when the talon is empty and all hand cards have been played. The player with the most collected cards wins the game.

boardgame.name: WÃ¶rter Fuchs
boardgame.description: Wörter Fuchs contains 5 long word dice which have five letters per side. The players have to write down as many valid words as possible using the letters on these dice, until the hourglass (2 minutes) expires. There are two modes to play the game: either take exactly one letter per die or form a pillar from the dice and the letters must be used in the correct order from top to bottom. The player with the most valid words wins. Players with a unique word gain additional points. The number of used dice in the second variant can be varied.

boardgame.name: Rolling Alnite
boardgame.description:
Unabashedly inspired by Jamey Stegmaier’s Rolling Realms game, we have developed a simple Roll & Write game featuring the Haus Alnite drag king/queen personalities.

The theme is to fill out as many of the sections as possible (earning a geometric shape) to flesh out a drag persona on the figure at the bottom of the sheet. Your score improves the more shapes you have that match each other.

Any number of players can play this game simultaneously. Each player needs 4 standard dice (6-sided) and a printed copy of the sheet to fill out. You can download the image of the sheet and load it into Google’s JamBoard, any photo-editing app or graphic design software where you can mark it up as needed.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Shadowrun 4th Edition Character Sheets
boardgame.description:
from the acknowledgements:
These sheets are a conversion of a set done originally by a Shadowrun player and fan that went by the handle Wordman. He had stated upon his own website, an intention to not update his original wonderful character sheet design to be compatible with 4th edition rules.

Realizing that sheets of a suitable design were definitely needed, I took it upon myself to update the sheets to match up with the latest edition of the game. It is with Wordman’s permission that this document exists, and is available for distribution.

A few pages are direct copies of his original design, while others are updated or completely redesigned to better fit the 4th edition ruleset. As a rule, the document from start to finish follows the design ideas and layout concepts originally created by Wordman, including this cover page.

While I can take credit for the arduous task of updating the sheets, the layout and design creativity lies solely within the Wordman. It is our hope that the community enjoys these sheets as they had Wordman’s original design.

The City of Hillsfar has endured continuous chaos since the Rage of Demons. First Lord Vuhm Yestral dreamed of stability the day he took office. boardgame.name: 18TraXX 2020: Great Plains Railroading
boardgame.description:
TraXX. That sounds like a good name for a railroad company! Well, let’s make it so. The game, the convention that inspired it, and a key company in the game, are all called TraXX. It is the design intention that the TraXX railroad be an important feature of the game. TraXX is player-controlled and partially government-subsidized company that assumes control of troubled railroad companies. Headquartered in Denver, well, that’s where the TraXX convention is held every year, TraXX can spread out across the plains and in so doing relieve struggling company presidents of their financial burdens. TraXX 2020 is intended to be a “lively” game as many companies will come and go during the game and TraXX may be used for good or otherwise. Additional “McGuffins” include minor railroad companies, boom towns on the plains, the Bailey Yard, and Pullman cars. You’ll need familiarity with, or a copy of, the rules to 1830 to play the game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: 18Grand Junction
boardgame.description: The McGuffins in 18 Grand Junction, an 18xx game, include a restrictive track set and the mountainous Colorado terrain. The yellow plain track only upgrades only to the complex green plain track (16, 17, 18, 19, 20, 21, and 22). After all, it is the Rocky Mountains, you can’t just build track where ever you want. The other primary McGuffin is Company Presidents. The presidents give a special ability to a railroad company in a manner similar to private companies would (there are no private companies in 18 Grand Junction). When a company starts, it selects a president. The first rank of presidents is “retired” in Phase 3 (brown) and each company selects a new president at the end of its next operation. You’ll need familiarity with, or a copy of, the rules to 1846 to play the game.

boardgame.description: 1888 is an 18xx game. Players operate their railroads in Jefferson and New Suffolk, two fictional states within the United States. “Event Cards” are a nice way to add historical flavor to a game, but a deck of random events being flipped over each round is not what we’re after. The train deck is stacked with event cards that are intended to entice players into changing their train buying habits. Additional “McGuffins” include two-sided train cards with a more powerful train on the reverse, and unconventionally, priority deal established at the beginning of each stock round. You’ll need familiarity with, or a copy of, the rules to 1830 to play the game.

boardgame.name: 1883 Express d'Orient
boardgame.description: 1883 Express d'Orient is an 18xx game set between Budapest and Bucharest, players control companies that are headed by different “company presidents”. Two company president cards are randomly assigned at the beginning of the game to each company. These cards give the company a specific ability from phase 2 through phase 4 and another ability from phase 5 until the end of the game. Additional “McGuffins” include giving the players the ability to skip the last train of a type in order to buy the first train of the next type, private companies that pay more revenue once connected to the rail network, and a non-player investor that buys and sells shares based upon the current status of each company. You’ll need familiarity with, or a copy of, the rules to 1830 to play the game.

boardgame.name: Echo Actual
boardgame.description:
Echo Actual is a wargame that fits well between the tabletop simulations and war/boardgames on your shelf. The system is adaptable for playing on a variety of maps you already own with a soon-to-be-released bundle of OPORD scenarios designed specifically for Echo Actual.

A number of features help Echo Actual stand out from other wargame offerings, including;

A combined arms game, the system is designed to allow players the selection of a specific Commander before assembling a mission-specific force with Sections, Teams and Modifications that can be equipped, further pushing the specialized capabilities of each unit.
The entire force must stay connected to the Communications Net to avoid the horrific consequences of a Blue-on-Blue attack.
At the beginning of the game, units are deployed face down - when spotted, they are revealed!
Some units have highly specific skills. The Electronic Warfare unit can cripple an enemy communications net. The Engineer Section can build a number of Fortifications.


The Core Rulebook includes print and play instructions to get you in the fight!

Tokens for everything listed in the Combined Arms List make for a quick start up. Also included are instructions for creating a set of DIY tokens in case a player didn't have access to a printer.

The first installment of Echo Actual will serve as the platform for a number of expansions.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Requiem LARP Quick & Dirty Rules
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This is the Quick & Dirty rules of Requiem LARP. While not meant to be all encompassing, it is the bare minimum that needs to be read in order to play the system. This lite version is meant for people that understand the basic concepts of LARPing, but want a quick download on Requiem’s specific rules set. If you are confused while reading any concept here, feel free to refer to the real rulebook. This document is not meant to be a replacement for the real rules, but a condensed and abbreviated form that keeps it short and simple, for first time players, or as a reference.

boardgame.name: Godzilla Rampage: Kaiju Unleashed
boardgame.description:
Game Objective – Players choose Kaiju and battle each other in an all-out melee till one player has defeated all of the other player’s Kaiju and is declared The King of the Monsters!

Starting the Game – Taking turns, one at a time each player chooses one Battle Kaiju for their team till all players have a total of 3 Battle Kaiju chosen.
• One at a time each player chooses a section of the game board. Place them together to form a (4-part, section) game board.
• Players start at opposite ends of the board with their characters spaced apart.
• Play rock, paper, and scissors to decide which player goes first. Game play then continues with the player to the left.
• Shuffle and place face down off to the side of the board within reach of all players the Kaiju Assist Cards.
o Each player may draw 1 card and keep it hidden from all other players.
• Each player takes 3 Rampage Counter Cards and places them next to their kaiju.
• Place 2 Military Vehicles on the game board in the designated areas. Refer to Military Vehicles below for placement/respawn info.
• If you have a kaiju that can either fly or burrow, take a Burrowing & Flying Counter Card for each kaiju.

Game Round – After each player has had all of their kaiju go, a round has passed.
• During a turn, each player’s kaiju goes. Players may choose to do nothing with a kaiju on their turn if they wish to not move it or do a battle.

What to do during your Turn
At the start of a player’s turn, they must announce which one of the following actions they are going to do to start their turn for that particular kaiju.

Battle – Each player rolls 2 dice and the highest die roll wins. The defender wins ties.
• Each Battle Kaiju Card and some select Kaiju Assist Cards have a Wound Counter on them to keep track of when a Kaiju receives a hit.
• Once a player’s Battle Kaiju receives a KO, that Kaiju is no longer in play. Remove that Kaiju from the board and flip over its Kaiju Battle Card.
o Kaiju Assist Cards: Some require being defeated. Once defeated, follow the same rules as above for Kaiju Battle Cards.

Grab/Throw – Grab a Building/Vehicle; roll 4+. To throw a grabbed object; roll the die, the die amount rolled is the x number of spaces you may throw that object.
• Destroying Buildings & Bridges: They are destroyed when a player’s Kaiju attacks them. Attacked Buildings/Bridges are destroyed on a die roll of 4+.
• Once a Building/Vehicle or Bridge has been attacked or used as a ranged attack they are no longer in that space and are considered destroyed. Place a game logo chip on that space.
Hint: Use objects as ranged attack against other player’s Kaiju. A player’s Kaiju takes a hit from a building on a die roll of 3+ and a hit from a vehicle on a die roll of 5+.

Melee Attack (Punch/Kick) – A standard attack against another player’s Kaiju. Refer to Battle for info.

Kaiju Battle Card Special Ability – An attack unique to that Kaiju that can be done against another player’s Kaiju.
• Range Attack Ability: Some characters can perform range attacks. These characters can aim at an opponent’s Kaiju that are in line of sight.
o Line of Sight is an imaginary line drawn from the center of one Kaiju’s head to the center of another Kaiju’s head. If any part of the imaginary line touches or crosses a Kaiju or a building, the Line of Sight is blocked.
• Kaiju must wait x number of rounds before they can regain their range ability back; depending on distance they used their attack.
o Each Kaiju who can perform a Range Attack has a Range Ability Counter on their card to help players keep track of when their Kaiju can perform the ability again.

Movement – Roll the die and see how many spaces you can move a particular Kaiju. This action can be combined with any of the above on a player’s turn.
• Players can either use regular movement or burrow/fly movement on the board and then either do battle, grab/throw or a range attack.

Sharing Spaces – Only a player’s Kaiju may share a space with one other Kaiju they are using at a time. Other players Kaiju may not move onto space with another player’s Kaiju.
• Tails & Wings: Some Kaiju figures have tails/wings that extend into an adjacent square. The Kaiju is NOT considered to be in the square which its tail/wings occupy. If another Kaiju moves into the tail/wings occupied space, either move it off the side to make room or turn the Kaiju figure in the opposite facing direction.

Military Vehicles – These vehicles are sent to defend the city against Kaiju. They seek out the nearest Kaiju and battle them.
• During setup, place only 2 Military Vehicles on the game board two spaces away from the middle and facing opposite ends of the board.
o There will only ever be 4 Military Vehicles on the board at once.
• During a player’s offensive turn, the other player or players (defense) move the Military Vehicles. Any time a Kaiju moves visible to a Military Vehicle, that Military Vehicle will move two spaces towards that Kaiju. Buildings and other Kaiju block Military Line of Sight.
o If the Kaiju moves out of view of a Military Vehicle, that Vehicle will not continue to pursue the Kaiju.
• Military Vehicle Firing (attack) distance: May fire (attack) any Kaiju from a distance of 3 spaces away; long as they are in line of sight.
• Destroying Military Vehicles: They get hit by a Kaiju’s Melee/Ranged Attack, including Thrown Objects or a Kaiju enters the same Space they are in.
o Military Vehicles will spawn at beginning of every round (unless the max number is already on the board) at one of the game setup locations. Player(s) who destroyed a vehicle the previous round or have the fewer number of kaiju on the board will be the one to place a vehicle on the board.
Hint: Use Military Vehicles as projectiles against other player’s Kaiju. A player’s Kaiju takes a hit from a Military Vehicle on a die roll of 5+.

Kaiju Assist Cards – Players can only have 1 Kaiju Assist Card at a time. It can be played at any time, depending on what is written on the card.
• After a Kaiju Assist Card has been played or is no longer in play, place it in a discard pile. Once all of the cards have been used, shuffle the cards and place them face down like at the start of the game.
• If a player draws a Kaiju Assist Card that they do not wish to use or hold on to, they can discard it at the end of their turn. At the start of the next round and it is their turn, they will draw a new card like normal.

Rampage Mode – As a player’s Kaiju wins offensive battles, its Rampage Counter will go up 1 level. After Winning 5 Battles that player’s Kaiju will reach Max Rampage Level.
• On your next turn (or any other offensive turn) go on a Total Rampage against the opponent's Kaiju!
• You have 3 Battle Energy to use within your kaiju’s Rampage. A standard Battle (Punch/Kick) is worth: 1 Battle Energy and ability off your Kaiju's Battle Card is worth: 2 Battle Energy.
• Each player has a Rampage Counter Card next to their Kaiju Battle Card to help you keep track of your Kaiju’s Rampage level.

Burrowing & Flying Kaiju Special Abilities – Some Kaiju have the unique special ability to be able to either burrow or fly. When a player uses this Kaiju’s ability, they can ignore Buildings or Bridges that may be in there way.
• At the start of the player’s turn, they must announce which Kaiju they’re going to use and if they’re going to use the Burring & Flying ability prior to rolling the die for movement.
• Kaiju cannot end their turn under or top of bridges, buildings or water spaces. A player may end either turn on the same space an ally kaiju only.
• In addition, a player’s Kaiju can do pass through another player’s kaiju that is in a space.
o This ability cannot be used during Capture the Flag scenario.
• Player’s will keep track of when they can use this special ability by using the Burrowing & Flying Counter Card. A player’s kaiju will need to wait up to 6 rounds (depending on the x-number of spaces traveled) before using this special ability again.

Water Spaces – If a Kaiju is passing through water spaces -1 is subtracted from their die movement. Kaiju using the flying ability can ignore this rule.

Military Vehicles, Kaiju Assist Cards and Rampage Mode are all extra optional game features to Godzilla Rampage: Kaiju Unleashed.

boardgame.name: Shards of Tomorrow
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Shards of Tomorrow is my love letter to 1986. It’s an old-school sci fi game jam packed with love for the genre. It’s fast. It’s loose. And it does it all, running a tight set of rules layered over a B/X-inspired classic game engine.

When I was thirteen, I spent my afternoons making up starships and imagining worlds that I thought I would never explore. Now I can.

Maybe you will, too.

boardgame.name: Forgotten Legends: The Worm Emperor
boardgame.description:
Forgotten Legends : The Worm Emperor is a high fantasy game set in the magical world of Aiine. Your goal is to prepare a foothold into an uncharted territory and sustain your war effort. Find and defeat the Prince of Despair, his majesty, the Worm Emperor, by breaking the three magic seals which protect his fortress and challenge him to a deadly duel.

Lured by the promise of earthly riches and eternal knowledge in an uncharted region of the realm, the party of Heroes must battle chimeric creatures, flesh and dark thoughts mingled together by magic and molded into fierce monsters born from the depths of a dreadful mind, complete trials which will reveal the very fabric of their soul, fight, scavenge, loot and trade to survive the journey and ultimately face the abominable overlord, the Master of Lies and Prince of Despair, his majesty, the Worm Emperor.

Replayability : The core of the game is entirely player driven. Heroes decide (individually or as a group) where the game is heading, from fighting an epic monster down to trading and building new dwellings in the castle they settled in. Many paths lead to victory.

Automa System: You move, his majesty, the Worm Emperor and his acolytes are moving as well. The enemy army is already on the march to conquer the regions and consolidate the domain of despair. Sooner or later, your armies will meet.

Castles and Outposts: A game within a game. You may start the adventure from any sub-region on the outskirts of the adventure map. Once settled in, you can build new dwellings, trade in the market for items, recruit creatures, complete puzzles and more.

Unique Adventure Map: Divided into three major regions and a fourth special inner region (controlled by the Worm Emperor) and counting more than 65 independent sub-regions the party of Heroes will have the freedom to explore a uniquely designed map with one-of-a-kind characteristics. Conquer cities, acquire resources, uncover mysteries and secret locations.

Modular Battlefield: Constantly changing its configuration depending on the sub-region you are exploring. The setup is randomly created each time your party clashes with a monster or a group of monsters. Terrain obstacles, power-up spots or de-buffs areas will hinder you or help you win the day.

---description from the publisher

The first cat to win fifteen points will become the leader of all the territories! Good luck, and may the best cat win!

boardgame.name: ETEREA
boardgame.description:
Originally it was Time, a tumult of uncontrollable energies, then Space, an infinite fabric in search of a foothold, then Matter arrived as a parasite ready to infest the rules of the Game. Finally she came, blossomed by a tear of light, which gave rise to all living beings, now she has been imprisoned by her power-hungry children and you will have to free her. ETEREA princess has been chained to the heart of the first world, her children, custodians of the six dimensions , they overturned the throne determined to master the fundamental principles to be able to reign over the entire universe. What was once a thriving planet is now a distant memory, that place where life was born has died out, the Vital Essences, now lost, they no longer generate beings and the thread that binds all the galaxies is corroded and close to splitting. The last hope is a handful of Architects, faithful heralds of the princess, designers of all perceptible dimensions and im palpable. Only they will have the ardor to undertake a mission to the limit of the impossible to try to subjugate the six tyrants, take their keys and free ETEREA from an unacceptable fate; if they fail, everything will be lost, the universe, as we know it, will cease to exist giving way to despair, chaos, ruin.

In ETEREA you are one of the architects who will attempt the enterprise to recover the keys, guarded by the six Bosses who govern the six dimensions: Water, Fire, Wind, Earth, Cosmos and Oblivion, to free the princess and save the whole ETEREA is a game divided into two parts: in the first you will have to wander through the six dimensions trying to reconstruct the Requirements, now swept away by the tyrants, to repopulate them; doing this will allow you to acquire Requirement cards and Artifacts, which are essential to succeed in the mission; to create the Requirements you will need careful planning in the dice roll and a careful use of certain skills or Vocations. In the second part you will have to face the Bosses and recover the keys, in doing so you will have to build your dice set , thanks to what I learned in the first part, and launch yourself in a desperate attempt to defeat them in an unequal duel, but thanks to a careful strategy, nothing will be impossible. There is more, always keep an eye on the time that passes , you will only have eighteen hours, a single day on ETEREA, then everything will be lost. Only an Architect will be able to succeed in the heroic action, but everyone will be able to perish in battle leading everything known to ruin. Good luck, that the glow of ETEREA accompany you.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Merchants of Infinity
boardgame.description:
Welcome to the boundaries of space. Where worlds meet and collide. Where mysteries abound and fortunes are there to be made – destinies to be forged, aboard the Mandelbrot space station. Do you have what it takes to beat the technobazaar, get the best deals, fulfill ship orders, trade, scheme and outwit all the other Merchants of Infinity?

Merchants of Infinity is a space-bound game of resource-management, worker-placement, hand-management, set-collecting, auctioning and making lots and lots of money! Will you have the cunning and skill to master the markets, buy, trade and profit from the wildest dreams of spacers far and wide? You will need to use strategy, guile, quick-thinking and planning ahead to amass a fortune and win the game!

M.O.I takes place on Mandelbrot: a space station on the more-pleasant reaches of fractal space. Traders, adventurers, travelers and tourists explore its crowded streets, sample its strange foods and trade and negotiate their way to profit and prosperity. Gameplay is in several phases: First player is determined by a separate card-slinging round; second, the real trading begins then lastly, scores are resolved and we begin again! Whoever makes the most profit and gains the most Platinum (Victory Points) in a set number of rounds wins the game.

Players are influential merchants with wide-ranging influence and money to invest, to maximize profit. Should they trade in technology or navigational charts this cycle or put their money into spices, jewelry and food? Will they win their desired resources at a bargain price at the auction or secure a valuable order for goods at the spaceport? The clock turns, the warp winds and fractal space unfolds..!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Fearsome Foes: Animated Objects
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Catalog of Creatures!

While the player characters are always the stars of every adventure, the most important supporting roles are almost always played by their foes, whether they take the form of terrible monsters with strange and awesome powers, or NPCs who rely on skill and training to rival adventurers in combat. In either case, it is often the abilities and powers of these opponents that make each combat a memorable and exciting experience, and so each installment of Fearsome Foes presents a number of new opponents connected to a specific theme, each of which has fun and memorable abilities for GMs to unleash on unsuspecting players.

This installment provides six new types of animated objects, which make suitable challenges for adventurers of any stripe. While all of these monsters are animated objects, they aren’t all statues and suits of armor. Instead, a wide variety of different types of objects were selected, each with unique and exciting powers and abilities related to what they are. In this book you’ll find:

The animated bookshelf (level 1), which can toss its contents at foes singly or in a horrible flurry of paper, and can deliberately fall on a foe to attempt to pin them to the ground.
The animated electric chair (level 5), which is not only capable of grabbing victims and strapping them in, but can electrify captured foes, or even release a burst of electrical energy.
The animated oven (level 8), which can release blasts of flame and clouds of smoke, as well as swallowing creatures and roasting them alive inside it.

boardgame.description:
Little Factory, first released as Goods Maker, is a resource management and building construction card game for 2-4 players with a playing time of about 30 minutes.

Players increase their assets by processing resources into other resources, such as turning wood into wood or charcoal, or turning charcoal and flour into bread. If you increase your assets, you can build a building and use that building to acquire resources and victory points more quickly.

The more buildings players construct, the more actions that become available on future turns. On a turn, players take one of two actions:


Production: Choose a resource card or building card in the production action area, and gain the item shown on it; or,
Trade: Discard resource cards from your hand to acquire resource or building cards of the same value or less from the available cards.


In addition, players can use the effects of each building they own once per turn (including on the turn during which they were acquired). An example of a building effect is: exchanging a thread card in hand for cloth available in the play area. Chain together cards, buildings, and actions to create more victory points. The player who collects 10+ victory points first wins!

boardgame.name: The Cursed Keep
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Mid-Level Fantasy Adventure
Intended for 4 to 6 player characters of levels 2 to 4

A MYSTERIOUS PLAGUE IS AFFLICTING A SMALL FARMING VILLAGE.
THE LOCAL HEALER SAYS THE DISEASE WAS CAUSED BY AN EVIL MAGE.
THEIR ONLY HOPE OF A CURE LIES IN AN ABANDONED WIZARD’S TOWER.
CAN YOUR PARTY STORM THE TOWER, FIND THE CURE AND SAVE THE DAY?

Greetings adventurers and Game Masters!

I am happy to announce release “The Cursed Keep”; a mid-level one-shot adventure fantasy adventure intended for 4 to 6 seasoned adventurers of levels 2 to 4.

Synopsis: In this adventure your players will find themselves in a village facing a deadly plague. They are approached by a local healer who explains that this malady is unlike any other he has encountered; neither his herbal knowledge nor his divine prayers can affect it! Researching the malady the druid learned two things: first, the illnesses began shortly after a strange visitor had come to the village and put on a magic show, and second, each of those afflicted cough up a strange glowing, green vapor.

Realizing this plague might be a magical creation set loose by this mysterious enchanter, the druid dug deeper into local archives and questioned old timers. He discovered a nearly identical plague afflicted this region over a hundred years ago, and that disease was cured by a benevolent archmage who came to the village’s rescue. He also found a map detailing the location of the archmage’s tower in the dangerous and untamed forest that borders the village.

Armed with this knowledge, the druid is seeking a band of heroes to travel to the supposedly abandoned tower, uncover the archmage’s remedy, and return to the village with the cure before it is too late!

Can you players save the day!

This module is part of a new series of “generic” adventure from Starry Knight Press, written to be system agnostic and usable with OSRIC (& other OSR games), compatible with D&D 5E, and useable with any fantasy ruleset.

While aiming to offer a non-rules specific module, we do include Monster Statistic Blocks for both OSRIC and 5E in the appendices, to be useful to the majority of our readers. However, the GM will still need to refer to their gaming manual of choice for complete monster statistics and treasure descriptions.

boardgame.name: Physician
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The art of medicine has been practiced by humans for thousands of years. Since prehistoric times, when the healing power of certain plants and other natural materials was first discovered, medicine has undertaken a slow but inexorable advance, each new discovery building or improving upon those before it. At the forefront of this advance were those who took up the art of healing, at first blending primitive lore with religious overtones; but with the coming of such luminaries as Hippocrates, Galen, Imhotep, Avicenna, and Sushruta, more rational applications of medicine began to take root. These were among the first of those known today as doctors, or Physicians.

Physicians in Cepheus Engine and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game (OSFRPG) need no longer be consigned to the background, called forth only when one of their colleagues gets hurt. Career: Physicians puts them into the thick of the action with three new types: Warriors, Researchers, and Practitioners, making the team’s doctor more than just a bandager and pill-pusher. Also offered are a new skill and a mechanic for determining how successful a Physician is likely to be by putting them through med school.

Career: Physicians. There is a doctor in the house.

The essential building blocks to all that exists within the Material Realm consist of the four fundamental elements of air, earth, fire, and water. The world of Enolia emerged from these elements and remains imbued with its everlasting impetus. The people sprawled across its vast lands have learned to manipulate these base aspects, from the simple spark to grand displays of whirling bonfires.

The Chronicles of Ballidrous Campaign Setting relies heavily on accessing elemental magic to run an adventure with depth and flavor. This book grew from this obligation to broaden the scope of magic, to compliment the available material. The first sections are dedicated to the setting, to include cosmology and a brief breakdown of the core religions in northern Ballidrous. This will aid in understanding the principles and sources of magic. The remainder discusses two new subclasses for the Elementalist with reference lists and descriptions of new spells to complete the expanded Elementalist’s spell lists.

boardgame.name: Eternal Palace
boardgame.description:
In Eternal Palace, you are a noble family who has pledged to help the Emperor rebuild his palace left derelict for centuries so that you may gain his favor. You must send your team to collect resources and rebuild monuments. You will also honor the Emperor by painting a beautiful picture of his beloved gardens and palace — but others are trying to impress him, too, and only one will have the honor of being chosen as the Emperor's favorite.

In this game, your team of workers is represented by dice, and by placing them on the game board you contribute towards rebuilding the different parts of the Eternal Palace. Each location is reached based on dice rolls, but if others have gone to an otherwise inaccessible location, you may visit it too by paying fish, one of the resources in the game. Complete tasks first — or contribute more than your competitors to these monuments — to earn tokens reflecting your overall effort. Recruit new workers to your team, and use the painting pieces you receive as each location is unlocked to "paint" a record of your work, layer by layer.

Who will contribute the most to the reconstruction and gain the favor of the Emperor? Find out in this tense and highly interactive Eurogame!

Bexim's Bazaar Pages


Growder’s Tent - each month, 4 new magic item cards

boardgame.name: Night of the Ninja
ÐÐ¾ÑÑ ÐÐ¸Ð½Ð´Ð·Ñ
å¿è ä¹å¤
boardgame.description:
Night of the Ninja is a fast-paced game of deadly secrets, midnight assassinations, and paper-thin alliances. In Night of the Ninja, your mission is to defeat a rival ninja House ...if you can figure out who they are! Each round, you choose your ninja role: a Spy or Fortune Teller gains valuable information, but only a Shinobi or Blind Assassin can cut down an opponent. To win, you’ll have to trick your opponents, figure out who can’t be trusted, and fight for your House!

Night of the Ninja supports 4-11 players, and a single round can play out within 5 minutes. Created by Justin Gary (Ascension, Shards of Infinity), it's designed to appeal to anyone from novice gamers to social deduction enthusiasts. Every card features papercraft art by Ben Charman, intricately hand-cut and photographed to create a unique, evocative visual style.

Night of the Ninja offers several twists on the social deduction genre. The team-based play means you can win Honor even if you die, as long as your House prevails. Each round begins by drafting Ninja cards, and no role is strictly better than others. The deadliest cards are also the last to be played, and gathering information can be as valuable as assassinating another player.

Night of the Ninja contains everything needed for up eleven players: 33 Ninja cards, 11 House cards, 11 Player standees, and 35 Honor tokens.

boardgame.name: Party, Party!
boardgame.description:
Party, Party! is a game of risk and excitement. Because of his birthday, Mickey decides to have a super party! Your goal is to invite as many friends as possible.

Shuffle all the tiles (numbered 1 to 5) and lay them in a circle.

On your turn you throw the die and move Mickey Mouse that many steps. If the value of the tile is higher than the die, your turn ends. If the value is equal to or lower than the die, you have two options:

Claim the tile and end your turn, or
Cover the tile with the Mickey Mouse disc and throw the die again. You move Mickey again and if the second tile equals your die or is lower, you win both tiles. Otherwise your turn is over and you receive no tiles.


Mickey moves from tile to tile (clockwise) until there's only 1 tile left. Then, you simply throw the die for that last tile. Once the last tile is claimed, the game is over. The player with the highest total value of claimed tiles wins the game.

boardgame.name: Age of Valor: Thunder in the East, Russia at War 1877 and 1904
boardgame.description:
Thunder in the East, Russia at War 1877 and 1904 is an independent Age of Valor (AOV) expansion chapter or mini-module for Age of Eagles II, also known as Napoleonic Fire & Fury. It covers both the Russo-Turkish War of 1877 and the later Russo-Japanese War. As such AOE II is needed to properly play this game. In most cases all rules changes have been imbedded in the Data Charts as well as the charts and tables on the Quick Reference Sheet. All players need to do is use these new specifications or DRMs with the original rules, then play as normal. Any changes unique to the Russo-Turkish and Russo-Japanese Wars, the subject of this expansion set, are included for both the conflict overall, and the included battles of Plevna, Aladja Dagh, Telissu and Liao Yang scenarios.

The AOV product line is sold primarily via a digital PDF distribution format, though a hardcopy version is available from certain retailers. It is 44 pages long

From publisher blurb:

Races of the Void: Vodeim expands upon the spice world Eimharn and its indigenous people. Prepare to meet the amphibious vodeim race, the deity of self-sufficiency Camdar the Capable, and the bloodthirsty stickweed camouflaged amongst the marsh grasses.

Also included are archetypes, domains, and sorcerer bloodlines with ties to many distant planes.

The vodeim are an exciting new race for your Starjammer adventure game. Vodeims are natives of Eimharn, hatched in the varied bodies of water that sprawl across the planet. Once hatched, vodeims spend their first five years of life developing their swimming skills while exploring and foraging in the water. After five year’s time, a vodeim’s lungs reach full maturation, granting the vodeim an expanded habitat that includes terrestrial terrain as well.

Ready to play in your Starjammer science fiction fantasy game (Pathfinder based) or quickly adaptable to your Starfinder adventures, the vodeim offer interesting options as player characters:

Use your Protective Pigmentation to adapt to your surroundings and avoid detection.
Explore below and above the waves with your ability to swim and breathe both air and water with Dual Habitat.
Use your Cartilaginous Skeleton to maneuver out of tight spots with ease.
Expand your character options with the Chronicler cleric archetype, Master of the Balanced Palm monk archetype, Prowler ninja archetype, Spirit of the Land hunter archetype, and the Waymaker and Muscle of Israfel inquisitor archetypes.

boardgame.name: Blood Sweat & Iron: A Simple Set of American Civil War Ironclad River Combat Rules
boardgame.description:
Blood Sweat & Iron is a simple American Civil War Ironclad river actions rule set, it uses a very simple combat system to allow you to play battles within a couple of hours.

The system uses datasheets for each ship in the game, all are at the back of the rules ready for you to print out and use.

It is meant to be a fun game that offers the players a feel for the river battles of the era, this is not meant to be a true historical simulation.

There are no huge charts needed to play as almost everything you need is either on the ship’s datasheets or on a Quick Reference Sheet, all tokens are supplied as well.

The rules cover over eighty ships of the time, plus a few extras to add to your games like shore forts, barges and fire rafts etc. etc.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Elder Scrolls: Call to Arms â Quests
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Tamriel – a realm of adventure and wonder. Where danger lies around every corner and where fame and fortune await the bold. It is a realm you can enter today, if you have the courage to answer the Call to Arms!

The Elder Scrolls: Call to Arms is a tabletop wargame set against the epic, sprawling backdrop of Tamriel. From the teeming cities of Cyrodiil to the towering mountains of Skyrim, across the ash-plains of Morrowind, and through the steaming swamps of Black Marsh, you must lead your Party of bold warriors on the path to glory. In this game, you must select a mighty champion to lead your Party, surrounding them with heroes and staunch followers. Players can take on quests, unearth magical artifacts, and fight roaming monsters as they do battle against their opponent, using a combination of strength, stealth and magic to win the day. Call to Arms is a simple game to learn, but a challenge to master; your Party can be assembled in an almost endless variety of ways, each unlocking new tactics and abilities with which to test your skill as a commander and challenge your enemies.

Whether exploring trap-filled dungeons, or battling in some windswept wilderness, Tamriel is yours to explore – or exploit – as you see fit, building your forces to take on all comers. This rich setting gives players the opportunity for a vast array of different game types and play styles, as well as collecting and modeling highly detailed, characterful miniatures from The Elder Scrolls universe.

This Quest Book is the gateway to starting your adventure in Tamriel!
It contains additional rules to those found in the Rulebook. Here you will learn about the different Game Modes, where you can battle with your friends or take on the wilds of Tamriel alone.
Most importantly, you will find numerous ready-to-play scenarios, providing tactical challenges and narrative adventure for your games!

boardgame.name: Pretty Fairy Princesses
boardgame.description:
From Publisher Description:

Pretty Fairy Princesses is a rules-light role-playing game where those three descriptors are your core statistics. Pretty represents your self-confidence, charisma, and energy. Fairy represents the strength of your supernatural heritage. Princess represents your emotional thoughtfulness.

Pretty Fairy Princesses uses a poker deck for its action resolutions. When taking an action, a player has a number of chances to reveal a specific type of card. The number of chances is based on the number assigned to the appropriate core stat. The type of card needed is based on a descriptor assigned to the appropriate skill.

So let's say Princess Rainbowgallop wants to make a gift for Dr. Turtle (a scrapbooking action). Rainbowgallop has a 2 in the Princess stat and a Hearts in the scrapbooking skill. The player has two chances to find a card with the hearts suit in order to succeed.

There's a bit of cooperative communication thrown in, but that's the core.

boardgame.name: Storm the Gate
boardgame.description:
Knights, archers, and berserkers head into battle with one shared goal: to infiltrate the enemy's castle.

Storm the Gate is a two-player dexterity game, with each player sitting at opposite ends of the game board.

The object of the game is to get rid of all tokens on your side of the board (your camp) by shooting them onto your opponent's side (opponent’s camp) through the gate in the center of the board. This is accomplished by pulling the tokens against the bungee in your camp and releasing.

Once a player no longer has any tokens in their camp, the game is over.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Storm the Gate: Woodland Warfare
boardgame.description:
In the times before The Divide, the inhabitants of The Veiled Forest existed harmoniously. The seasons came and went each year, and there was peace among all creatures that made these woodlands their home. One morning, at the very edge of the winter solstice's arrival, all of this changed.

Storm the Gate: Woodland Warfare, the sequel to Antsy Labs' Storm the Gate, is a frantic tabletop dexterity game in which you must rapidly move your army of heroes into your opponent's battle camp.

Introducing more depth than its predecessor, Storm the Gate: Woodland Warfare offers players the choice between two factions and six heroes - each hero belonging to a class with its own unique abilities and token dimensions.

You win the game by clearing all tokens from your camp before your opponent can do the same.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.description:
"French and Indian War 1757-1759" is a strategic wargame on that conflict in America during the peak war years of 1757 to 1759. One side commands the British and its allies while the other commands the French and its allies. The object of the game is for the British player to control enough key locations in New France to win the war. The French goals are to protect New France while pursuing its own strategy of gaining territory in the American colonies.

boardgame.name: A Touch of Glamour
boardgame.description:
(from the Kickstarter page) A Touch of Glamour is game about fey creatures in a modern world, trying to escape from human beings who would exploit them for their magic. The game is Powered by the Apocalypse.

Players have a tool kit between the four universal Attributes and Moves that makes it fairly easy to remember what to do, and how to do it. Masques are tags that the player can call on anytime they want, adding to the fun.

Scenes flow with a flexible pace whether they deal in social arcs or combat - largely because rolls are fast and easy to adjudicate, simply by choosing a Move and powering it through an Attribute. What's more, narrative control is largely shared; A Touch of Glamour encourages collaborative play between GMs and players as they build their stories up.

boardgame.name: Twilight Imperium (Fourth Edition): Laserox Command & Control Tokens
boardgame.description:
Player color coded command and control tokens for Twilight Imperium 4th edition by Fantasy Flight Games.

Available in all 6 colors: black, red, blue, green, yellow and purple. One set is for one color.

Included are:

16 command tokens
16 control tokens
1 home system token to mark your home tile

Choose the token set to match your player color, so you can recognize your areas easily during the game. Use the command and control tokens as you normally would during gameplay, but now using your player color tokens instead of the race symbols. Place the home system token over your home system planet icon for a refence to the color being used by that player. Command tokens have a blank side and an engraved side. The blank side is used for the strategy and tactics pool. With the control token in the player color, it is very easy to see who controls what during the game.

boardgame.name: Santa Fe
boardgame.description:
In Santa Fe, the players — western heroes that they are — aim to take as many tricks as possible during the eleven rounds of the game, in addition to collecting as many points as possible.

Unlike most games, lower-valued cards are worth more as the deck contains fewer of them. The players can challenge each other, as well as the sheriff, to the Mexican standoff. After a duel, only one player is left standing, and this player takes several tricks at the same time. The player who fights a duel at the most appropriate time and collects the largest points — as well as the highest number of special bandit cards — will be the final one standing when the game ends.

—description of publisher

boardgame.name: Tapestry: Broken Token Organizer
boardgame.description:
As you weave the history of your civilization you don’t want to worry about how to store your game. Advance in style with this organizer from The Broken Token compatible with Tapestry by Stonemaier Games.

This organizer includes 17 removable trays that make set-up lightning quick and enhance many aspects of gameplay.

Set-up is a breeze starting with the Tech Card Tray, which houses all the Tech Landmark buildings, and is placed next to the game board to match the indicated locations for the Tech Card deck and 3 revealed cards. Then, simply slide out the Tapestry Cards Tray and place it next to the game board. The exploration tray holds all territory and space tiles, and the Mat Tray holds all the civilization mats and capital city mats, which you’ll pass out next. Hand each player their chosen color in one of the five Player Token Trays which hold all of a player’s token cubes and outpost tokens, with room for each player to have their own set of additional science and conquer dice. These pair with the Ready-to-Play Income Trays, which are placed directly from the box on each player’s income mat. Finally the Ready-to-Play Landmark Tray is ready-to-play directly out of the tray, and is designed to simply be removed from the box and set right on the table so you can get started playing right away.

This product is a kit that requires assembly. The use of wood glue (sold separately) is recommended.

Publisher blurb:

Expert Nova – a role-playing game for action and mysteries in settings from the late Victorian era to a near future in which man still is the measure of all things. Put your players to the test in London’s seedy alleys, the trackless jungles of the Amazonas, the catacombs under Paris, or the Templars’ hidden headquarter.

Action is skill-based: roll 1D20 as low as possible.

Campaign design guidelines with a 1950s Australian science fiction setting as a hands-on example.

Archer role and armour cards

The Class Acts series introduce new archetypes and character options for the character classes you'll find in the Player's Handbook and elsewhere. Every PDF contains three full pages of high-quality content that gets straight to the point - no fluff or filler.

Class Acts: Barbarians introduces one new primal path (the path of the Lunatic) and four new totems for Path of the Totem Warrior barbarians (the panther, sphynx, shark, and vulture totems). You'll also find two new feats herein (and they're not just for barbarians!): Menacing Presence and Sunder Shackles.

boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the future. Golgotha is a game of exploration and danger in mysterious, dead installations at the edges of humanity’s interstellar sphere. The players take on the roles of a crew of Scavengers who seek out, penetrate and rob these ancient lost structures, known collectively as the Golgotha. To those lucky enough to survive the risks, arifacts await – lost technology that the mysterious Overseers who rule the Human Sphere covet. Find something of value and in return the Overseers will boost your body, allowing you to fi nally seek that revenge you have always dreamed of…

This is an adventure location for Golgotha featuring the War Hive, an ancient weapon of a long-dead alien race. It can also be used for other roleplaying games of far-future exploration and discovery.
